abstract: Alan D. Schwartz may have a broad range of career choices, now that he has decided to leave JPMorgan Chase. But according to The New York Post, the former Bear Stearns chief executive won’t go without a spot reserved for a longtime lieutenant.
lead_paragraph: Alan D. Schwartz may have a broad range of career choices, now that he has decided to leave JPMorgan Chase. But according to The New York Post, the former Bear Stearns chief executive won’t go without a spot reserved for a longtime lieutenant.

headline.main: Schwartz Job Must Include Spot for Lieutenant, Report Says

abstract: In what would be one of the biggest mining deals in Russia this year, the metals tycoon Mikhail D. Prokhorov announced that he would sell his 16.6 percent of Norilsk Nickel for $10 billion.
snippet: In what would be one of the biggest mining deals in Russia this year, the metals tycoon Mikhail D. Prokhorov announced that he would sell his 16.6 percent of Norilsk Nickel for $10 billion.
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW  In what would be one of the biggest mining deals in Russia this year, the metals tycoon Mikhail D. Prokhorov announced on Tuesday that he would sell 16.6 percent of the Arctic mining giant Norilsk Nickel to his former business partner, Vladimir O. Potanin.

headline.main: Russian Tycoons Agree on Sale of Arctic Mining Stake
headline.print_headline: Russian Tycoons Agree on Sale of Mining Stake
